alert.note: Alert for Central Cook; DuPage; Lake; Northern Cook (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 09 at 3:29AM CST until March 10 at 7:00AM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 7 AM CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Accumulating wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations ranging from 2 to 4 inches near the I-290 corridor, to 4 to 7 inches closer to the Wisconsin border. * WHERE...Lake IL, DuPage, and central and northern Cook Counties. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 7 AM CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Untreated roads will become snow covered and travel difficult, particularly between 8 PM and 2 AM when the heaviest snow is expected to fall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow rates are likely to peak near 1 inch per hour early this evening. The expected heavy, wet nature of the snow will make shoveling hazardous.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Illinois can be obtained on the internet at www.gettingaroundillinois.com.

area.areaDesc: Central Cook; DuPage; Lake; Northern Cook
